urls.title: Jessica Chou (@choutoo) • Instagram photo
urls.description: Jessica Chou shared a post on Instagram: "The icon @michelleyeoh_official for @latimes Thank you @himguydude for making my dreams come true (and helping me impress my mom). Still picking up my jaw from the floor... And if you haven't seen it @everythingeverywheremovie is a true cinematic masterpiece. I don't think I've seen my story told so specifically on screen and it broke my heart (in the best way possible) at how wacky, universal, and masterfully it was done. Dream Team @bnickleberry @mariatroncosogibbs Styling @msjordanjohnson And special thanks to my creative collaborator @helananas for helping me set the visual direction and find my center on this shoot!". Follow their account to see 494 posts.

urls.title: Highlights from 2019! Thank you for a wonderful year
urls.description: Mark Zuckerberg, George Takei, United States Census 2020, and the tiny band of Somali immigrants who took on Amazon and won. These were just some of the people and stories I got the photograph and the journey in making the photos has made this year a great adventure. I landed my first cover with Fortune followed by another for WIRED. I completed my first advertising job shooting the print spot for the United States Census 2020 Asian language campaign, which will be out next year. If you know about my

urls.title: The Multifarious Multiplexity of Taika Waititi
urls.description: He makes big movies and little movies, funny movies and sad movies—but mostly big-little funny-sad movies. Waititi is a bundle of contradictions.

tweets.text: In the newest edition of WIRED, Jennifer Kahn meets actor, writer and director @TaikaWaititi. Known for his eccentric style, oddball comedy, and subversion of the superhero beat—he's really just a man “trying to not do whatever the grown-ups say.” https://t.co/23TW70k0oI 1/14

urls.title: The Multifarious Multiplexity of Taika Waititi
urls.description: He makes big movies and little movies, funny movies and sad movies—but mostly big-little funny-sad movies. Waititi is a bundle of contradictions.

tweets.text:
COVER STORY: @TaikaWaititi makes big movies and little movies, funny movies and sad movies—but mostly big-little funny-sad movies. He's a bundle of contradictions—but that hardly covers the multifarious multiplexity of the man: https://t.co/NInoepgoca

📸: @Choutoo https://t.co/nShPdfc1gk
Being the first often means you have to be the best — and the bravest. 📸 @sbmaneyphoto for @nytimes https://t.co/DSZiawlnDd

@choutoo We're excited to learn from you Jessica!

just ONCE i want to see a female journalist on tv who isn't trying to seduce her subjects. seriously that plot line is officially retired. irl it goes subject hits on you (not vice versa) and it screws up your whole story cause you can't speak to him anymore the end BORING.

urls.title: The American Abyss (Published 2021)
urls.description: A historian of fascism and political atrocity on Trump, the mob and what comes next.

tweets.text: "The lie outlasts the liar. The idea that Germany lost WWI in 1918 because of a Jewish 'stab in the back' was 15 years old when Hitler came to power. How will Trump’s myth of victimhood function in American life 15 years from now? And to whose benefit?" https://t.co/vy5ViyKWd3
😡 https://t.co/wLZJNdr9LH

(THREAD) Media has yet to do a deep dive on precisely what Trump *said* in his January 6 speech in DC—a speech now called an "incitement to insurrection," and the basis for an article of impeachment coming Monday. This thread unpacks the speech. I hope you'll read on and RETWEET. https://t.co/ba6eaNScNW
It’s going to take you a long time to read this thread. And by the end you’ll be very angry. But it’s important that we all understand. https://t.co/AaCVhMbyzU

Maybe I'm being too harsh but I don't care whether these people resign or stay on with 14 days left to go. 

I care if they say, publicly, that the President is unfit, and the 25th amendment or impeachment should be invoked. Anything else is just about them and their reputation. https://t.co/AaSe9DDYzb

I want to be careful in how I say this because obviously you can't just break into the Capitol and desecrate offices and hit police officers with pipes. People should be arrested. But I don't think they should be our focus.
Spare a thought for the photojournalists in the Capitol right now, being actively targeted by a violent mob and continuing to do their jobs.
@iamclaudiusjr He deserves the right music. https://t.co/W3k6xoFEkp
Can someone help me find this man who delivered my mom’s package in Providence...he deserves a Christmas bonus✊🏾😂 #PVD https://t.co/v10h8Crrp4

DAH very publicly documented his attitude towards sexualizing young women including his assistants throughout his career. I don't want to hear about the silence of his victims when the he himself was speaking loud and clear. Everything we needed to know was In. His. Pictures.

Don't miss your chance to pre-order the limited edition 2020 Women Photograph Annual! We'll take orders until January 5:
https://t.co/wNJn0HvPEk https://t.co/ZfyjuRjXoy

We're thrilled to present the Women Photograph 2020 Year in Pictures, featuring images from 100 women & nonbinary photographers who together have created a poignant visual record of this... unusual year. Take a look!
https://t.co/JEG6eYOTRH https://t.co/CIWNkdTO04

Here’s what we’re NOT gonna do: give up.

We don’t give up when people need us most. That’s not who we are.

Our democracy is at a faint heartbeat; it was broken even before Trump. But so long as we can save lives, I believe we have an obligation to do so as we build a new world. https://t.co/QBGqflpihC

Thank you, @EW.

Story: @marcus_jones
Motion Photography: @TiffanyJenelleJ

Clearly when given the opportunity he will not & I will not stay up late at night waiting for an apology from a man who has no remorse over calling women & using abusive language towards women." https://t.co/XKymFh3Oyf
WATCH: Full speech by George Floyd's brother, Terrence Floyd, at site of George Floyd's death. https://t.co/piEcnilzCb
Here's a handy list of some independent Black women + non-binary photographers based around the USA for photo editors looking to hire:
Rest in Power, Tony Allen https://t.co/vKmkTvjQX3

A photo editor at @NYMag's @TheCut has reached out to an incredible number of Women Photograph members looking for free photo essays from photojournalists documenting their lives during COVID-19 quarantines and lockdowns.

It is both disrespectful and immoral for a commercial for-profit publication like @NYMag to ask independent creatives for free work at any point, but even more so now given the risks we all are facing in the field and the financial stress this crisis is placing on all of us.
We seriously hope that @NYMag + @TheCut will reconsider their practices and come up with a solution that dignifies the work and livelihoods of all of the women in this industry.

This week in quarantine, I painted my all time favorite musician and composer @trent_reznor. Inspired from the song “Copy of A”. Reference from a photo taken by photographer @choutoo. Spraypaint on 6’x6’ canvas. . https://t.co/euDM6EzaRl

Opened twitter this morning, & the first tweet I read told me that Bill Withers has died. Terrible news, coming after weeks of terrible news. I sing his songs to myself all the time. I'll sing one today. Rest in Peace.

@AndrewYang A lot of us are VERY upset because you are for better or worse the biggest voice in Asian America today and you advised people to present ourselves as more American when we’ve done nothing to warrant questions of our Americanness.
In a conference call, hoping the racists will be nice to me https://t.co/qIEauEOUF9
@choutoo @aperturefnd Woo hop!
@choutoo @aperturefnd Brava!
@choutoo @photogsofcolor @aperturefnd Congrats!

We tell working families to try and keep 3 months saved for a rainy day but multi-billion dollar corporations like our airlines did not have more than a few weeks of reserve for payroll! It’s outrageous. We need requirements for a minimum 6 month payroll reserve for corporations.
From over 900 submissions, we are thrilled to announce the five shortlisted artists ✨ https://t.co/e1Y02QgRGu

6.6 million first time claims this week.

3.3 million last week.

10 million Americans have lost their jobs in the past 2 weeks.

Ten.

Million.

If we can somehow afford this:

💰 $1.5 trillion tax break for corporations 
💰 $1.5 trillion cash infusion into the stock market

Then we can definitely afford this: 

✅ Emergency EITC to give up to $6,000 to everyone who made $130,000 or less last year.
The United States will be powerfully supporting those industries, like Airlines and others, that are particularly affected by the Chinese Virus. We will be stronger than ever before!
My @netflix comedy special Asian Comedian Destroys America! dropping Dec 17! @netflixisajoke https://t.co/tkJ9ad8pIo

Amazon has met its match! They might be a tiny group of Somali immigrants, but they are led by Somali women who have the spirit of Arawelo. Don’t sleep on Somali women, we don’t play 💪🏽 https://t.co/XjmohgpYoz

Today at the Atlanta Airport. I was beaming with pride. Thank you to this brilliant Somali Muslim sister, for her courage standing up to billionaires on behalf of workers.  Amazon Meets It’s Match and her name is @Nimo_EP. ♥️ https://t.co/WxFx7LtF9B https://t.co/iS0olFxy8Q
Don’t sleep on us. PERIOD 🗣 https://t.co/ZS0evcF2jQ

Fed up with their working conditions, a handful of employees from East Africa took on Amazon. They pulled off feats of organizing no Amazon workers ever had before.

This is the inside story of the showdown between Amazon and a group of Somali immigrants.
https://t.co/j7vMZS312x https://t.co/SozZ7rMGD0

This is Nimo Omar (@Nimo_EP), cofounder of the Awood Center (@AwoodMpls): an East African workers center that has become a dominant voice in the struggle for labor and civil rights at Amazon. Please read my @wired cover story here: https://t.co/llR1O1OqHz https://t.co/5mEyXQcciR

urls.title: Meet the Immigrants Who Took On Amazon
urls.description: How a group of Somalis became leaders in the fight to change a tech behemoth.

tweets.text: Our new @wired cover, featuring a riveting @jessbruder  feature on the Somali immigrants who were actually able to bring Amazon to the negotiating table. #mustread https://t.co/peyoVY7Ob5 https://t.co/S4RNAvsIsp
Miriam Gonzalez Durantez talks feminism, her husband Nick Clegg's new job and why she loves her new life in Silicon Valley https://t.co/jwhGutvKU8

Meet the women leading Netflix into the streaming wars 
https://t.co/Vjy25ovWhl
I love everyone that is apart of this! Congrats @mlevram Jessica Chou and Michele Taylor! So badass! https://t.co/U1MJH7MYTk https://t.co/lPVV0mT5jU
@choutoo Saw this on my united flight today! Great work!

After a hot streak of roles in critically adored TV hits—"Killing Eve", "Barry", "The Good Place"—Kirby Howell-Baptiste joins a murderers' row of leading ladies in the CBS All Access dramedy, "Why Women Kill.” https://t.co/2Kep9kqBXq Photos by @choutoo https://t.co/qAmS0sOonT

TAKING THE STAGE AT 2:45 PT: Intel CEO Bob Swan joins @fortunemagazine’s  @adamlashinsky for a live interview where they will discuss our transformation to a data-centric world and the opportunities ahead for Intel: https://t.co/sCf5V5D5uG #BrainstormTech https://t.co/mpDdkRWxAO

Brad and I wish everyone a happy #pride weekend. So many positive changes over the last 50 years. For one, I was able to marry Brad and this year we celebrate our 11th anniversary as husband and husband. ❤️💕 #stonewallday

Photo Credit: Jessica Chou https://t.co/Y7XcTqyeFd
